user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Laura Mercier is my favorite brand for highlighters. I use this shimmer bloc in the winter, since I think the pink tones of this compact look better on pale winter skin than a lot of the golden toned highlighters out there. I like to use this on the inner corner of my eye, lower lash line, and on my brow bone, because I can use a smaller brush to pick up one color. This doesn't work as well for an all over cheek highlight, because if you use a bigger brush it's going to pick up all the colors. I mean, you can do that, it's just not what I prefer.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Type Normal', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: Beautiful color and shimmer, but very delicate. I bought it less than two weeks ago and it broke into pieces when I accidentally dropped. I liked it so much that I will repurchased!

I was in my 4th bronzer and having no luck when I came upon golden mosaic and I instantly fell in love! If you like shimmer and a healthy golden glow you'll like this bronzer. I'm very fair and using a fluffy brush this product gives a nice, radiant finish. Use sparingly though , a little goes a long way. Won't make you look dirty, muddy or yellow. I think deeper complexions would be complimented also.

This shimmer bloc is great for using as a blush regardless of the season--it just looks really natural and good. It gives a great natural color while also providing a subtle sheen to make your cheeks look great. Just make sure you get the right color.

Lately I have been obsessed with the highlighting trend. I watch every YouTube video about highlights I read every review on highlights and I own probably about 20 or more. Lately I have been on a mission to find the brightest most pigmented highlighter so I have been testing them all. After spending a fortune at Sephora this weekend I realized that none of the new highlighters were making me happy so I decided to go through my make up collection and go through everything I own I mean stuff from 2016 to stuff from 2005. And I found an unopened golden shimmer bloc from I would at least say 10 years or more. I put it on a fantail brush and thought in my head why have I not been using this Laura Mercier product when half of my make up collection is Laura Mercier why did I stop using that shimmer bloc?? I also like to think I was way ahead of this highlighting trend because this was at least 10 years old I guess I somehow got away from doing my highlight routine. This morning I tried to amp it up a little I took my fantail brush swirled it around all the colors in the golden shimmer then sprayed my brush with NYX Matte setting spray before applying it to my cheekbone and omfg my cheeks are blinding they look like the sun amazing it's the perfect blend of colors I find with most highlighters they just don't work right with my undertone the Laura Mercier looks amazing on pale skin on olive skin tan skin on all skin with mixing all the colors around it just makes this amazing multi tonal color. I am going to Sephora today to get the other two colors I do remember using the pink one back in the day about 10 years ago and I liked it as a blush highlighter all in 1 and I always thought the gold one was going to be too dark on me but if you swirl it all together it goes perfect on any skin tone. Take it from a girl who has tried every single brand highlighter my boyfriend must want to kill me because lately that is all I've been talking about is highlighters soon as I mention one I think his eyes already start rolling in his head but I must say this shimmer bloc is number one I highly highly recommend...

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Green']
review_content:
Ok Ladies, if you are confused about highlighter this one makes it SO simple! Just swirl a blush brush throughout the colors and it produces a beautiful multi dimentional glow on your cheeks. I am 45. I absolutely hate when I see women of any age with streaky, white, ultra glowy highlighters on that makes their skin look shiny and greasy. This one doesn't do that! It looks so natural and it is so simple to apply. I use the Pink mosaic (fair skin, dark hair, green eyes) and it is perfect. I use it just like a blush. No more 2 steps applying blush and then a highlighter on top and wondering where the highlighter should go. This one combines two steps and with one easy step you look perfect. It also builds easily for occasions when you want a more dramatic look. I use it lightly for an everyday look and I love it. I was a long time fan of Nars orgasm and Nars blushes in general. This one is far superior in my opinion and lasts all day. I have replaced all of my Nars blushes and Becca, and Hourglass highlighters with this one. It is all you need!

review_content: I often find that blushes are too pink/red for my skin but this has a great yellow undertone for me! It adds a perfect glow and shimmer when blended together, and makes for a great palette for more contouring if wanted. It's not too glimmery, as some highlighters can be, it just makes it look like you've spent a few hours in the sun with a warm glow.
I use this highlighter in peach mosaic and it is absolutely one of my favorite highlighters. The application of this product is very smooth and the finish result is just stunning.
It's a beautiful color and can be worn daily. It's applied in a thin layer and it doesn't create brrakouts. I highly recommend it!

I disturbingly own 3 of these (golden mosaic, peach mosaic, and tbe discontinued mosaic). I love them all and I am incredibly happy with this product. These function great as a highlighter with a nice sheen and no glitter. They aren't crazy intense (nor are they subtle), but they can be built up. They also work great as an eyeshadow for a light wash of color on the lid. These are extremely versatile. For example, Peach mosaic alone can be used with great variety- the pink and peach as a blush topper, the copper as a bronze topper, the white as a highlighter that gives a "wet" look. This is a great place to start if you are looking for a highlighter.

review_content: If you have light skin like mine you will love this. it gives a gorgeous glow to the skin (cheeks). makes your skin look very youthful. I love it. it is pricey but worth every penny. :)

I will start out by saying that this is the most beautiful highlight I have ever used. I used the peach shade, but my friends with pale skin have worn the original Mosaic and it is INCREDIBLE. Knocks Kevin Aucoin celestial powder in candlelight out of the cosmetic ballpark. Finely milled, glowy but never overly shimmery, the product is perfection when it is in one piece. That being said, mine shattered as did those of two other friends of mine. No dropping on the ground.. they just broke for no reason. After that, it was unusable. Thanks to Sephora's excellent return policy, I was able to return it sans packaging and receipt. I will repurchase in the future, but not for a while as it is such a high maintenance product and in no way travel friendly.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Blue']
review_content:
I cannot even begin to describe how much I LOVE this product! I am very light-skinned with pink undertones, blonde hair, and blue eyes. Due to the overall fairness and pink in my skin, I have never been able to wear blush without looking “overdone.” I love the flushed look you always see in make-up ads, however, so I tried numerous blushes, bronzers, illuminators, shimmer bricks, etc. Unfortunately, everything was too dark, completely unnoticeable, or glittery and unnatural looking. I found the Laura Mercier Shimmer Bloc at Sephora and fell in love the moment the consultant put it on my face! I went with Pink Mosaic, which gave me that naturally “flushed” look without the obviousness of wearing anything. I like my make-up very natural – neutral eye shadows, black mascara & eyeliner, light blush, etc. – and this product nails it! A lot of shimmer products contain glitter, which I personally don’t care for, but the Laura Mercier Shimmer Bloc has a pearl/iridescent effect that creates a healthy glow. The color is buildable too, so, if you want more, you can easily make it a full-on blush. It’s truly an incredible product, absolutely everything I was looking for, and I hope they never discontinue it!

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Blue']
review_content:
I recently saw this product in my local sephora store and fell in love. The picture online does not do the gorgeous shimmer and glow that you see in person any justice. I saw reviews that it had streaky application, but I disagree. The product blends nicely but you must take the time to do so to get a more natural finish. Although, I do have one strong warning. It's very easy to overdo it because the shimmer bloc does have a lot of shimmer, so use a light hand when applying. The pigmentation isn't too overwhelming and the shimmer gives you a beautiful glow, which is perfect for the summer months!
